de.hu.logic.modal
Class TreeNodeEvaluation

java.lang.Object
  de.hu.logic.modal.TreeNodeEvaluation

public class TreeNodeEvaluation
extends java.lang.Object

This is a very simple evaluation algorithm that evaluates the formula from the inside out in the most naive way. Note that if the formula uses a proposition symbol that is not part of the signature of the TransitionSystem (nor a fixed-point variable) then no error is generated but the propositions is considered to be false on all vertices.

Author:
Stephan Kreutzer

Constructor Detail

TreeNodeEvaluation

public TreeNodeEvaluation()
Method Detail

evaluate

public ModalTreeNode evaluate(TransitionSystem trans,
                              Formula f)
                       throws de.hu.gralog.app.UserException
The main method of the class. This method first checks whether the signature of the transition system and of the formula are compatible. If they are, it generates an initial ModalTreeNode.

Parameters:
trans - Transition system
f - Formula to evaluate
Returns:
Returns the relation containing the set of vertices at which the formula becomes true.
Throws:
de.hu.gralog.app.UserException - Exception thrown if for some reason the formula cannot be evaluated in the system.

fixedpointEvaluate

protected java.util.List<Proposition> fixedpointEvaluate(Formula f,
                                                         Interpretation inter)
But what this method does is the following. If f is not a fixed point formula we do nothing. Otherwise, the fixed point iteration defined by f is performed and the list of all stages is returned. This can then be used by a ModalTreeNode object to generate its list of children.

Parameters:
f - Formula
inter - Context.
Returns:
List of all stages of the fixed point iteration defined by f (or null if f is not a fixed-point formula).

recursiveEvaluate

protected Proposition recursiveEvaluate(Formula f,
                                        Interpretation inter)
The main evaluation function doing the actual evaluation. An important feature is that if f is a fixed point formula then the result contains the number of stages in its name. This is used, e.g. in ModalTreeNode, to recover the number of stages.

Parameters:
f - Formula
Returns:
returns the set of vertices satisfying the formula. See above for conditions on the name.

checkSignatures

protected boolean checkSignatures(Formula f)
                           throws de.hu.gralog.app.UserException
Checks if the transition system provides the relations used by the formula.

Parameters:
f - Formula to be ckecked.
Returns:
true if the formula matches the signature of the transition system.
Throws:
EvaluationException - Throws an exception in case of an error.
de.hu.gralog.app.UserException
